Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)
Please check why build failed

Please take a look at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/72833
I think  it has a better approach to support sharing presence GPIO from multiple fans.  Sorry, i did not suggest this earlier
Done
@https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/69897
why change it to throw? I don't think the FanMain is designed to handle the throw from the constructor.

Based on a comment to the reactor (moving the PresenceSensor from TachSensor to its own files)
See https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/69897/comment/87a2217c_1b7edaa4/
What action should we be taking when we are not able to create the GPIO presence object? I will add catch in FanMain and that would basically ignore that GPIO missing (similar behavior to before)
These lines are common with lines 53 - 65. Move it to base class

I would like to get the refactor (moving the PresenceSensor from TachSensor to its own files) approved first, so I don't have to keep rebasing all of these commits.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/69897

The gpioLine.request is different, which is the point of the two different objects (event driven uses EVENT_BOTH_EDGES and polling uses DIRECTION_INPUT).
I can move the code up to that point to base class.
move this logic inside updateAndTracePresence since it also calls gpioLine.get_value or remove the get_value call inside updateAndTracePresence and add a parameter for "newStatus"
The event based GPIOs do not need this check. If an event was triggered, that means that the state should have changed. In the polling case, we have to do the check because it may not have changed.

Yes, my point is that get_value() is currently called within updateAndTracePresence()
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/73043/7..8/src/PresenceSensor.cpp#50
Done

nit: This file has lots of format change. Can you double check with clang-format?
If the format change is because of latest clang-format can you please separate the. It is hard to review difference as is.

It is due to latest clang format change. If I remove that commit, then CI will fail.
Note that is is all based on the Refactor PresenceSensor which Ed has not approved yet. He has asked for changes to the object name, so that commit has quite a few changes due to renaming.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/69897/
Can you please create a patch/review where only format is updated, no code change. Once that lands, update this to be only the code change so diff can be reviewed properly.
The only changes are lines 472-487 (the other is just formatting).  If you turn on "Ignore Whitespace" changes, the differences are really minimized.
ACK
status is not updated anymore
good catch
pinName is also helpful
Done
Done
Done

"\n"
other places also
Done
define a constexpr for the magic number
Done
nit: is "i" intended to be prefix? why not just deviceType and deviceName, which would be more consistent with existing code
It was to specify it as an input parameter. Done.
My comments have been addressed

dbus-sensor change has been merged:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/73043
